saturate.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Water poured through the hole, saturating the carpet.
saturate.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to put a lot of something into a particular place, especially so that you could not add any more
saturate.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Our culture is saturated with television and advertising.
saturate.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to mix as much of a solid into a chemical mixture as possible
saturate.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a type of fat from meat or milk products that is thought to be less healthy than other kinds of fat from vegetables or fish
saturate.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Choose a type of spread thatâ€™s lower in saturates than butter.
saturate.translation[2].definitions[0].d: to offer so much of a product for sale that there is more than people want to buy
saturate.translation[2].definitions[0].e: A flood of cheap Italian tomatoes has almost saturated the market.
Smaller banks are struggling to compete in an already saturated market.
